page.title: 12VINEYARDS FARM
page.content: The owner's of Vineyards farm are Mr and Mrs Norman. They have two children. The farm is 240 acres. The farm is predominantly sheep. Barley, wheat and grass is grown. The rotation is two years for corn and four to five years for grass. Corn is stored at 10% moisture. Mr Norman starts his lambing from February to March. Last year he had 453 lambs; he had to sell 303 of them to the butcher because of the drought for he didn't have enough grass to feed them. With the money he got for the lambs he bought fertiliser to help the grass. He now has got five rams. Mr Norman has one Massey Ferguson tractor. He does not employ any permanent labour but some friends and his wife help him when he needs it especially in the summer.
